column4: why is it that when i turn on my desktop , it's consuming 840MB of ram so i restart and it's only consuming 180MB of ram now.. i restart again and it's consuming 800MB of ram again
it's not X , x is only consuming 21MB
so no bad video driver
Use the system monitor and determine exactly what is consuming it
i did and it's not telling me
just little processes like 21mb they are not adding up to 800MB
Does it not list enough things?  What's telling you that it is taking 800mb then?
free -m
and on memory on system mananger

Free shows what is truly free.  Mine says 933 while sys monitor says 344.  The rest is "cached" what the system is keeping around cause it might be useful.  Techincally it is open cause the system will give it up if needed.  It's more complicated than simply "free" and "used" I'm afraid.
The linux stack is very good at handling ram!  Sys monitor shows what is being used by currently running applications.  free shows what is truly not being used by anything (not even the os itself)
this never happens in other distros
I'm using debian and the exact same thing is happening
i mean ram consumption
my system and ubuntu both use "preload" which uses significantly more ram but makes all the apps start faster (in fact it even prioritizes the apps you use the most)
You might wanna try "apt-get remove preload" and see if it helps
i don't have preload
Then I'm not sure what is in all that cached ram space.
hmmm i wonder why it's just in ubuntu , 10.4 in particuler
I am guessing it's the same feature I'm describing but implemented in different software.
actually this has only happened in 10.4
i'm kinda using this PC as a server too so this is really bad :S
I'm researching it
bastid_raZor http://imagebin.org/97404
